item.title: Arggh :(
item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

No, it isn’t pathetic. They have a point, you need to see the point. Evil_ is right, 90% of moparscapians need everything done for them, literly doing it for them, or they just C&P random pieces of code into their server without any know how on where to put it.

Evil_ tried to help him, and is good for it.
Telenubby also tried, but is doing it for him, listen, i came up in this community, the only way people will learn, is to teach them, not do it for them.
The two are much different, but people choose to do it for others.

Heads up mscp: l2l or gtfo.
Im tired of seeing dozens of threads asking: Omg how do i make npc drops:

Well, take the initiative to look at NPCDROPS.JAVA
How doesn’t someone have the common sense to look…

Sorry for hi-jacking this thread, but i needed to get my point across.

Very little people on this site attempt to do something for themselfs,
Telenubby, point taken for the fag comments, evil_ point taken for the spoon fed comments.

~~ Marc

squal707:

hm why do noobs get so mad over little things like helping some 1 i think its kinda funny but really pathetic…

I don’t want to see another post like that.

Edit: yes aftereffect i know i’m a moparscaper.

Read full topic

item.title: Arggh :(
item.dc:creator: @ricky_james ricky james
item.description:
@ricky_james wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:20, topic:158509”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=216007.msg1883033#msg1883033 date=1195196262]
Didn’t I just fucking say that? ffs

EDIT: Oh sorry, I didn’t spoon feed it to him the natural moparscapian faggish way, figured I’d let him do it himself, how about that.
[/quote]
Yes, you did. Did I see it? Do I give a crap? No.
Go back to MITB.

I’m helping him, that’s all that matters. When you started out, and I garuntee you did either in real Java or MSPS, you needed help like this as well. Infact, I’m pretty sure it’s easier to learn from examples. Yes, I know an example wasn’t needed at all, but I gave him one. Now tell me: What’s wrong with that?

I don’t care who you are, a vet, a moderator, or even an admin. I don’t want people like you coming from MITB and telling us on these forums that we’re “faggish people with faggish ways.” We might not know as much as some of you, but we all start somewhere. You can’t deny the fact that you used to be one of us, part of the ‘newbies’. E-Flaming doesn’t get you anywhere.

Oh, and to be honest, it’s possible to learn from copying and pasting. Although some of us don’t move on from it, some do. Get over it.[/quote]You dont need to be from MITB to have irc legend

Read full topic

item.title: Arggh :(
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

if (!p.playerHasItemAmount(R1, R1A) && !p.playerHasItemAmount(R2, R2A) && !p.playerHasItemAmount(R3, R3A) && !p.playerHasItemAmount(R4, R4A)) {
	p.sendMessage("You don't have the correct runes for this spell.");
        } else {
	p.deleteItem(R1, getItemSlot(R1), R1A);
	p.deleteItem(R2, getItemSlot(R2), R2A);
	p.deleteItem(R3, getItemSlot(R3), R3A);
	p.deleteItem(R4, getItemSlot(R4), R4A);
        }

There ya go.
If you get 100 errors or any errors, try removing that last bracket I added. Tell me how this works for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Arggh :(
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

1 sec, look at these ways i’ve tried.

if ((playerHasItemAmount(rune1, rune1am, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(rune2, rune2am, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(rune3, rune3am, rune3)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(rune4, rune4am, ID)==false)) {
p.sendMessage("Runes?");
} else if ((playerHasItemAmount(R1, R1A, ID)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(R2, R2A, ID)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(R3, R3A, ID)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(R4, R4, ID)==true)) {
try {
if ((playerHasItemAmount(R1, R1A, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(R2, R2A, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(R3, R3A, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(R4, R4A, ID)==false)) {
p.sendMessage("Runes?");
} else {
p.deleteItem(R1, (R1), R1A);
p.deleteItem(R2, (R2), R2A);
p.deleteItem(R3, (R3), R3A);
p.deleteItem(R4, (R4), R4A);
//Spell Stuff
if ((playerHasItemAmount(rune1, rune1am, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(rune2, rune2am, ID)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(rune3, rune3am, rune3)==false) && (playerHasItemAmount(rune4, rune4am, ID)==false)) {
p.sendMessage("Runes?");
} else {
if ((playerHasItemAmount(R1, R1A, ID)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(R2, R2A, ID)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(R3, R3A, ID)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(R4, R4, ID)==true)) {
p.deleteItem(R1, (R1), R1A);
p.deleteItem(R2, (R2), R2A);
p.deleteItem(R3, (R3), R3A);
p.deleteItem(R4, (R4), R4A);
//SpellStuff

With these, i either get, the spell works without runes, doesn’t delete the runes…

Or…

None of the spells work, you use the spell on the player, and i just walk to the other player… Please can someone help me fix this? Will reward…

item.title: Arggh :(
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:8, topic:158509”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=216007.msg1882331#msg1882331 date=1195151848]
This isn’t really a big deal, it’ll just cause your code to look A LOT neater, instead of

if(boolean == true)
or

if(boolean == false)

you can do:

if(boolean)//same thing as if(boolean == true)

or

if(!boolean)//same thing as if(boolean == false)

this will help your code look a bit neater, and easier to read.

I’d also suggest naming your variables better.

(I’m guessing R1 mean rune1?)

you could also extend the readablility by:

if(!p.playerHasItemAmount(rune1, runeAmount1)) {

OH AND:

p.deleteItem(R2, (R2), R2A); What’s the (R2) for?
[/quote]

I know i might sound like a bit of a snob now, but please re-read my post. Atm i’m not fussed about making it neat or anything, i just want it to require runes for the spell…

p.deleteItem(R2, (R2), R2A);

R2 = Rune 2…
R2A = Rune 2 Amount.

Idk it worked last time :|…

When i added something like that, sometimes it said “You do not have the correct runes” Great… But then it just stopped working lawl.[/quote]

Not to be a snob, but re-read mine

This isn't really a big deal, it'll just cause your code to look A LOT neater, instead of
lol <3

Anyway, What are the arguments of deleteItem?

deleteItem(int itemId, int itemPos, int amount);?
